title: The States With the Most and Least Expensive Gas Prices: See the Map
sub_head: Gas taxes, fuel infrastructure availability, and cost of labor and real estate all determine gas prices across states
body:
Gas prices are hitting record highs across the U.S., but the pain at the pump varies depending on where you live.
Across the world, fuel prices surged following Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine, which disrupted the global oil market. Rising oil prices along with increased demand as the summer driving season kicks off have driven the average cost of a gallon of unleaded fuel in the U.S. to $5.01, according to OPIS, an energy-data and analytics provider that is part of Dow Jones & Co., publisher of The Wall Street Journal.
